problem.markdown:
to the student should be the result of a plausible mistake that a student might make.
>>A certain company keeps a list of 50 employees and their annual salaries. When the salary of the very highly paid president is added to this list, which of the following measure of central tendency is most likely to be approximately the same or nearly the same for the original list and the new list?<< ( ) The highest salary ( ) The range ( ) The mean (x) The median ( ) The standard deviation
problem.script: def hintfn1(answer_ids, student_answers, new_cmap, old_cmap): global expect aid = answer_ids[0] ans = student_answers[aid] if new_cmap.is_correct(aid): hint='Your answer has been submitted' new_cmap.set_hint_and_mode(aid,hint,'always') new_cmap.set_property(aid,'npoints',1) new_cmap.set_property(aid,'correctness','corrrectnr') else: hint='Your answer has been submitted' new_cmap.set_hint_and_mode(aid,hint,'always') new_cmap.set_property(aid,'npoints',1) new_cmap.set_property(aid,'correctness','incorrectnr') old_cmap=new_cmap
problem.p: to the student should be the result of a plausible mistake that a student might make.

A certain company keeps a list of 50 employees and their annual salaries. When the salary of the very highly paid president is added to this list, which of the following measure of central tendency is most likely to be approximately the same or nearly the same for the original list and the new list?

choicegroup.label: A certain company keeps a list of 50 employees and their annual salaries. When the salary of the very highly paid president is added to this list, which of the following measure of central tendency is most likely to be approximately the same or nearly the same for the original list and the new list?
